column1: Siril was the greatest of the few rivers on the island of Númenor; it rose in the valley of Noirinan beneath the Meneltarma
column2: and flowed directly southwards to enter the sea at the fishing port of Nindamos
column3: on the borders of the Hyarnustar and the Hyarrostar. In its lower course it became a slow and winding stream
column4: meeting the sea among wide marshes and reedy flats.
